Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the tax cut, as the actual tax cut passed into law yielded an average of 4.9% for the targeted group, not the promised 10%.
Understate: The claim understates the actual tax cut achieved, as it fails to mention that the average tax cut for married filers who owe taxes is only 4.9%.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion of delivering on the campaign promise for a 10% tax cut for Wisconsin families.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 10% tax cut promised during the campaign was fully implemented, without considering the actual tax cuts passed into law.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the claim, as the actual tax cuts implemented fell short of the promised 10% and only resulted in an average tax cut of 4.9% for the targeted group.
